Title: Take Your Photo
Description: Please provide your photo for identification; we will need access to your device’s camera.

Step1.Title: Step 1
Step1.Description: Select your camera and take your photo.

Step2.Title: Step 2
Step2.Description: Crop or retake the photo if needed; then send for electronic signature.

Step3.Title: Step 3
Step3.Description: When the document opens for signing, add your personal information, sign the document, and select Finish.

SeeMore.Title: Behind the scenes
SeeMore.Text:
This sample features:

  • Embedded signing
  • Data entry tabs
  • Anchor positioning

Code flow:

View the source code on GitHub.

Step 1
When the button is selected, we ask the user to provide access permissions to a connected image-capturing device. Once the user takes the photo, it is retained to embed in a document to be attached to a DocuSign envelope.

Step 2
Using the Envelopes:create API method, we then create and send the envelope with a preconfigured envelope definition containing form input fields and a placeholder for the photo collected earlier.

Step 3
To harness embedded signing, we call the EnvelopeViews:createRecipient API method with the envelopeId from the previous step and a return URL to this application. This method then generates a signing URL for the signer, to which the user is redirected.

Step 4
With this specific application, we embed the envelope to sign inside a pop-up window or browser tab. After the envelope is completed, the signer is redirected back to the front end of the application with a success modal pop-up.

SuccessModal.Title: Signing complete
SuccessModal.Description: Thank you for verifying your photo! We’ve added it to your personal data.

WaitingModal.Title: Waiting for signing
WaitingModal.Description: The photo has been sent for signing; awaiting response.

ErrorModal.Title: Embedded signing failed
ErrorModal.Description: An error has prevented the embedded signing session from being displayed; please check the error message above for details.

WarningModal.Title: Alert: Camera not found
WarningModal.Description: It appears your device doesn’t have a camera! For demonstration purposes, we’ll provide a generic image.
